@tveskov I have 1.5 million on Twitter. I get way more than 2x the interaction on LI that I get on Twitter. I use Buffer to post to Twitter and LI simultaneously. I seldom get the same level of action on Twitter.
@fionag111 Good point. What a beautiful thing in-line threading is. Whenever I read @mentions here, I seldom know what tweet the person is reacting to!

@bakers_dawn I think you establish your circle of friends and reputation on a platform and use them wisely. This can be done on LI or Twitter or Facebook. It's just that here you have to worry about so many bad actors and Elon's daily decisions.

@muralianumolu If you are literally "afraid" that your boss is watching you on LI, then maybe you are at the wrong company. :-) And if your boss has that much free time, he/she probably isn't that great a boss.  But I digress...
@davewiner If everyone was as technically astute as you, I wouldn't be pushing LI on them. :-)
@ethanbeute @Apple @canva Glad to help. Please check out my podcast. It's the best work of my career. https://t.co/lm4C4heCa2

@roy_nishant No question LI isn't optimized for social media. But Twitter isn't optimized for good behavior and truth. Honestly, the LI app is flawed for social media, but 800 m users is hard to replace.
@lukemckeehan It's more accurate to say I'm evangelizing despite LI's reluctance to grab more action. I just see LI as a very useful platform should one wish to avoid the shortcomings here.
@JAaronG Why can't it be bought? How does it make money to operate?
@sanjeevkoushik A platform is what you make of it. There are no rules. I show pictures and videos of me surfing on LinkedIn all the time.
@the1stmegan So do that in your feed. What's stopping you?
@MattTuley A platform, IMHO, is what you want it to be. There are no rules. Just like you can use a Mac for SQL database access or creating TikTok videos...
@cyberdyne I would make the case that one should always be professional on all platforms. There is nowhere to just let it all hang out because you just don't know who's watching.
@manueldelaflor Says who? That's like saying Mac is only for word processing, spreadsheet, and database. But the market said it's for desktop publishing...not Apple.
@sunilpunjabi And what do you get on Twitter? I'm pretty visible on LI. i never get sales calls. But I do block lots of accounts.
@datamongerbonny When it comes to platforms, less is more!
@calguylacey I use Google and SmartNews for this. Not links on social media...
@tveskov Why is this necessarily so? I fire and forget posts on LI 10 times a day...
@fionag111 Amen. There are many things that are sub-optimal for LI as social media because of its roots. But it has 800 m users who are likely to be who they say they are behaving better...
